availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Johann Conrad Kolb (Jefferson County, Kentucky, tavern keeper.)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, tavern keeper. Native of Germany. Married to Catharina Koch Kolb in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in October 1852. Father of Cath Kolb, Mary Kolb, Kate Kolb, George Kolb, Peter Kolb, William Kolb, John Kolb, and Lillie Kolb. Tavern keeper in Louisville in 1860. Employed Mary Sutton as a servant in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville/Ward 3, p. 649.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville/Ward 4, p. 421A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000588548, p. 239.
"Conrad Kolb (1829-1886)," Find A Grave, Memorial #12742855, accessed May 5, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/127428355.
